Spinal muscular atrophy, lower extremity-predominant, 2B, autosomal dominant

XRef.DB: Department Of Translational Genomics (developmental Genetics Section), King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Centre

AttributeSet.Attribute: The term 'not provided' is registered in MedGen to support identification of submissions to ClinVar for which no condition was named when assessing the variant. 'not provided' differs from 'not specified', which is used when a variant is asserted to be benign, likely benign, or of uncertain significance for conditions that have not been specified.

ClinVarAccession.SubmitterName: Institute for Genomic Medicine, Nationwide Children's Hospital

Classification.Comment: The c.1636_1638delAAT variant results in an in-frame 3 base pair deletion and is predicted to cause loss of an evolutionarily conserved Asparagine residue in a non-repetitive region of the protein (p.Asn546del). It has not been reported in large population cohorts such as gnomAD. In silico modeling suggests that removing the Asn546 disrupts protein secondary structure in a region that has been shown (in mice) to bind KIF5A. This mutation occurred de novo in our patient and was reported by GeneDx in an unrelated patient who shared similar features. We therefore interpret the variant as likely pathogenic.

ClinVarSubmissionID.localKey: 609797.0009_SPINAL MUSCULAR ATROPHY, LOWER EXTREMITY-PREDOMINANT, 2B, PRENATAL ONSET, AUTOSOMAL DOMINANT
ClinVarSubmissionID.title: BICD2, 3-BP DEL, 1636AAT_SPINAL MUSCULAR ATROPHY, LOWER EXTREMITY-PREDOMINANT, 2B, PRENATAL ONSET, AUTOSOMAL DOMINANT

ObservedData.Attribute: In 2 unrelated patients with autosomal dominant lower extremity-predominant spinal muscular atrophy-2B (SMALED2B; 618291), Koboldt et al. (2018) identified a de novo heterozygous in-frame 3-bp deletion (c.1636_1638delAAT, NM_001003800) in the BICD2 gene, resulting in the loss of conserved residue asn546. The mutation, which was found by whole-exome or whole-genome sequencing and confirmed by Sanger sequencing, was not found in the gnomAD database. Functional studies of the variant and studies of patient cells were not performed, but protein modeling indicated that the variant is within a region that interacts with the molecular kinesin motor and that the mutation would alter protein structure.

Name.ElementValue: SPINAL MUSCULAR ATROPHY, LOWER EXTREMITY-PREDOMINANT, 2B, PRENATAL ONSET, AUTOSOMAL DOMINANT
Abnormality of the cerebral white matter

Classification.Comment: Not observed at significant frequency in large population cohorts (gnomAD); In-frame deletion of 1 amino acid in a non-repeat region; In silico analysis supports a deleterious effect on protein structure/function; This variant is associated with the following publications: (PMID: 33547725, 30054298)
